thread.title: Buster Posey offers Kyle Schwarber advice about catching
thread.title_full: Buster Posey offers Kyle Schwarber advice about catching

title: Buster Posey offers Kyle Schwarber advice about catching
text:
Manage Buster Posey offers Kyle Schwarber advice about catching Chicago Cubs fan favorite Kyle Schwarber has made it known that he wants to get back in the mix at catcher again, but San Francisco Giants star Buster Posey may talk him Slot to 247Sports Links 
Chicago Cubs fan favorite Kyle Schwarber has made it known that he wants to get back in the mix at catcher again, but San Francisco Giants star Buster Posey may talk him out of that idea. 
Schwarber missed almost all of the 2016 regular season after tearing ligaments in his knee, but he recovered faster than expected and returned in the World Series. The outfield and catcher spots are both crowded for the Cubs, and the added versatility could mean more playing time for Schwarber - but Posey thinks he should reconsider. 
Posey had a serious injury in 2011 after a collision at home plate, and he said it took him quite a long time to fully recover. 
"I always told people it took me a solid two years before I felt back to some sense of normalcy," Posey said in an article by the Chicago Tribune. "For the year or two after my ankle injury, there was maintenance after every game and spring training workout, whatever it may be. I'm feeling pretty good (now) and can back off it a little bit." 
Finding room for Schwarber and players like Ben Zobrist, Javier Baez, Albert Almora, John Jay and others will be difficult. However, the Cubs also have two solid catchers without Schwarber. 
Posey said Schwarber should be careful about getting behind the plate again. 
"We had two different injuries, but it's important to build up strength," Posey was quoted as saying by the Tribune. "But if my ankle felt cranky, moving over to first base helped."
